intro: Borreria spinosa var. minima, commonly known as the small spiny borreria, is a shrub native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its small, spiny leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant is adapted to thrive in dry, sandy soils and can withstand periods of drought. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of flowering plants. Its compact growth habit and ornamental flowers make it a suitable candidate for xeriscaping and rock gardens.
